• SimpleAuth.Authenticators.Torii
  • Source Code

  • 0.6.3

For a general overview of how Ember Simple Auth works, see the README

SimpleAuth.Authenticators.Torii

Authenticator that wraps the Torii library.

The factory for this authenticator is registered as 'simple-auth-authenticator:torii' in Ember's container.

Importing

ES6 modules
import Torii from 'simple-auth-torii/authenticators/torii';
Standard AMD
var Torii = requireModule('simple-auth-torii/authenticators/torii').default;

Methods

source

restore(data) → Ember.RSVP.Promise

Restores the session by calling the torii provider's fetch method.

Arguments

data Object

The data to restore the session from

Returns

→ Ember.RSVP.Promise

A promise that when it resolves results in the session being authenticated

source

authenticate(provider) → Ember.RSVP.Promise

Authenticates the session by opening the torii provider. For more documentation on torii, see the project's README.

Arguments

provider String

The provider to authenticate the session with

Returns

→ Ember.RSVP.Promise

A promise that resolves when the provider successfully authenticates a user and rejects otherwise

source

invalidate(data) → Ember.RSVP.Promise

Closes the torii provider.

Arguments

data Object

The data that's stored in the session

Returns

→ Ember.RSVP.Promise

A promise that resolves when the provider successfully closes and rejects otherwise

Extends

Base

Methods

  • restore
  • authenticate
  • invalidate
